validator.AppInfo: only written medium
for a whole resource or part of a resource that is recorded as an audio file
for moving image; used for multi-media corpora, with video for the moving image part
for stillimage like photographs, drawings etc.
for the description of sensorimotor data (e.g. biological measurements, geospatial data etc.)
for n-gram resources
A form in which NLP taks are realized and delivered to a user, without the need of acquiring and installing the corresponding tools
A technology that eases the development of new tools and services in the NLP field
A device that performs one or more of the tasks listed in the ForeseenUseInfo component
A more of less fixed integrated organisation of tools applied for solving a combinaton of tasks
A technology that supports the flexible development of NLP applications, together with all the requested resources
A technology that supports the development of data resources, like lexicons, grammars, corpora, etc. Can be included in an Architecture or in a Platform
An article from a journal or magazine
A book with an explicit publisher
A work that is printed and bound, but without a named publisher or sponsoring institution
Technical documentation
A report published by a school or other institution
A Master's thesis
A PhD thesis
A part of a book, which may be a chapter (or section) and/or a range of pages
A part of a book having its own title
The proceedings of a conference
An article in a conference proceedings
A document having an author and title, but not formally published
Use this type when nothing else fits
Value for compatibleLexiconType; to be used for grammars that are compatible with wordnets
Value for compatibleLexiconType; to be used for grammars that need wordlists for their operation
Value for compatibleLexiconType; to be used for grammars that need lexica with morphological information for their operation
For lexica that are included in the grammar file
For lexica attached to a resource (e.g. as a different file in the same directory, or downloadable from another position); the element attachedLexiconPosition should be used for further information
For grammars that can use any lexicon as long as they of a compatible type; the element compatibleLexiconType must be used for further specification
Value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that can recognise the structure of clauses
Value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that cover pp-attachment (attachment of prepositional phrases)
value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that cover structure of noun phrases
value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that cover coordination
value for grammaticalPheonomenaCoverage; for grammars that cover anaphora problems
Value for task; for grammars used for anaphora resolution
Value for task; for grammars used for chunking (shallow syntactic parsing)
Value for task; for grammars used for parsing
Value for task; for grammars used for identifying noun phrases
Value for task; for grammars that are restricted to parsing titles
Value for task; for grammars that are restricted to parsing definitions
Value for task; for grammars used for analysis tasks
Value for task; for grammars used for language generation
Value for languageDescriptionType; to be used for resources describing the morphological, syntactic etc. system (or part therof) of a language
for text, speech, video, multimodal/multimedia corpora, corpora with sensorimotor information, n-gram resources
covers grammars etc.
includes lexica, ontologies, dictionaries, word lists etc.
used for tools, systems, system components etc.
